data.title: Feature Request - Pinned Tabs like visual studio
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
It would be nice to have pinned tabs so you don't loose the tabs you are working on from sight.
Also, have the option to have the pinned tabs in a separate row.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->

data.title: Auto guess encoding "big5" is not equal to "Big5"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.1 (27492b6bf3acb0775d82d2f87b25a93490673c6d, 2017-09-14T16:38:23.027Z)
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
ftp-simple|hum|0.5.7
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.3.0
---
Some of my file is encoding by Big5 (Traditional Chinese)
Visual Code autoGuessEncoding may random open them by encoding "big5" or "Big5" .
But "big5" is not equal to "Big5".
And big5 may cause some chinese word error.

Currently known word : "都" "起" "者"

data.title: 使用空格进行缩进时，从Code复制到OneNote（桌面版）的内容没有缩进了
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.1 (27492b6bf3acb0775d82d2f87b25a93490673c6d, 2017-09-14T16:38:23.027Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-eclipse-keybindings|alp|0.9.6
java|red|0.10.0



---
**原始显示**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11850956/30947919-24798e48-a43f-11e7-84e2-3262115f6370.png)

**复制到OneNote，颜色显示能保留，但行前空格都没有了。将空格替换成制表符后复制到OneNote，颜色显示能保留，位置正常。**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11850956/30948011-a4157388-a43f-11e7-843b-c2a312cdbf43.png)

不带格式复制到时（例如复制到eclipse），空格是正常的。

data.title: [loc][query] Please clarify where does "Editing evolved" show
data.body:
String text: Editing evolved
Context
src/vs/workbench/parts/welcome/page/electron-browser/vs_code_welcome_page:English (en):plaintext:welcomePage.editingEvolved
Resource
vs_workbench_parts_welcome

Query: Is it a slogan in isolated area? Where does it appear in software? Accept levrik's suggestion to revert German translation to English may be a good idea.
levrik wrote: I already stumbled over this translation very often and thought about a better one since the current one actually just means "Advanced editing" what does not really match the meaning of the English one. I would suggest to not translate this slogan/tagline. Don't think it really needs a translation at all.
Is that means "The thing, editing, evolved better" ?

Reference: https://www.transifex.com/microsoft-oss/vscode-workbench/translate/#de/$/111041640?issue=yes

data.title: [loc][query] Typo in source string. distinguinshing->distinguishing. is->are
data.body:
String Text: Show the name of the file. When tabs are enabled and two files have the same name in one group the **distinguinshing** **sections of each file's path is added**. When tabs are disabled, the path relative to workspace root is shown if the editor is active.
Context
src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/main.contribution:English (en):plaintext:workbench.editor.labelFormat.default
Resource
vs_workbench
Query: Typo in source string. distinguinshing->distinguishing. 
Should'nt it be "the distinguinshing sections of each file's path **are** added" and not **is**?

Reference: https://www.transifex.com/microsoft-oss/vscode-workbench/translate/#de/$/118705240?issue=yes

data.title: Cannot local right path files under 'symbol link' that created by 'mklink /j'

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.1 (27492b6bf3acb0775d82d2f87b25a93490673c6d, 2017-09-14T16:38:23.027Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
code-gnu-global|aus|0.2.2
python|don|0.7.0
vscode-clang|mit|0.2.2
cpptools|ms-|0.13.0
csharp|ms-|1.12.1
vscode-icons|rob|7.14.0



---

Steps to Reproduce:
If we have a code project folder d:\TestProject
1. mklink /j e:\TestProject d:\TestProject, so we can have a symbol link folder in e:\TestProject
2. open e:\TestProject with VSCode
3. open any file under the project in VSCode, we can see the path is d:\TestProject\..., not e:\TestProject\...

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: fix 'Source Control Providers' not showing up for only one repo
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/35279. If the existing behavior is intended, feel free to close this.

data.title: SCM Viewlet hides "Source Control Providers" panel with only one folder in workspace
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.17.0-insider (f7962f0682a76516df51de4856f8ccc5d8ad578a, 2017-09-20T05:10:59.524Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: none
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have only one git repo / folder in your workspace 
2. Open the SCM Viewlet, notice that the Source Control Provider's panel isn't visible
3. Add another folder to the workspace
4. Notice that they Source Control Provider's panel is now visible, and lists two providers

Is this intended behavior? I find it confusing to have the panel be hidden like that when I am working with a single repository - I expect the UI to be consistent.

data.title: Source origin is not shown for "loaded script"

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
- Debug a node app with node2
- Open `fs.js` from the sidebar, or from the loaded sources picker
- It doesn't show the origin, `read-only core module`

If I open a node_internals script from the callstack, it does show the origin.

The loaded source event looks like `{"seq":0,"type":"event","event":"loadedSource","body":{"reason":"new","source":{"name":"fs.js","path":"<node_internals>/fs.js","sourceReference":1022,"origin":"read-only core module"}}}`

data.title: Make sure dbus is set up on Linux
Add relativeDir launch config variable
data.body:
Addresses #33191

I'm not sure that this is sufficient - can someone give me pointers on how I can test this (it's not showing as an auto-complete option yet)?

data.title: Setting up Javascript in Visual Studio Code
data.body:
So I am trying to setup Javascript in Visual Studio Code, but I'm running into problems.
I get these messages: "To use JavaScript Standard Style please install JavaScript Standard Style by running 'npm install standard' in the workspace folder Visual Studio Code
or globally using 'npm install -g standard'. You need to reopen the workspace after installing JavaScript Standard Style." and "To use ESLint please install eslint by running 'npm install eslint' in the workspace folder Visual Studio Code
or globally using 'npm install -g eslint'. You need to reopen the workspace after installing eslint.'. Also, it doesn't connect to localhost and it says "This site can’t be reached. localhost refused to connect.". When I hit launch I also get the message "Could not install typings files for JavaScript language features.". I have installed the Debugger for Chrome extension and also these: ESLint, JavaScript(ES6) code snippets, JavaScript Standard Style, markdownlint, npm(0.2.1),npm(3.3.0),  Npm Dependency, npm Intellisense, NPM Link Status, Npm Smart Importer, p5js Snippets and Quokka.js.
Finally, I have node.js installed. Please help I have been trying for days.

- OS Version:Ununtu 16.04 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I'm going to clone a GIT repo in my local GIT folder
2. When I'm in VSCode doesn't switch automatically to SCM Git provider interface and, if I'm going to try to switch from the menu there's no GIT option.
3. I still have the default view insted of GIT (with GIT icon on the sidebar)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Mac press and hold accent character insertion does not update suggestions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.17.0-insider (e059563fb6b8905de79ac4c75be537bb6dc74f5f, 2017-09-27T09:42:20.756Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0


---

Steps to Reproduce:

Using a mac

1. Ensure word based completions are enabled
1. Create a blank text file with the contents:

    ```
    abc
    äbc

    ```

2. On the last line, press and hold the a key until the alternative character selector is shown.
3. Select ä from here

**Bug**
The suggestion list is not updated after the `a` is replaced with `ä`. It is updated if you trigger the suggestion list again:

![sep-27-2017 15-33-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12821956/30941226-4065adae-a399-11e7-8827-c30013d8a827.gif)





<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Syntax color of declared identifiers changes if type is present
data.body:
In a const block, if a declaration is explicitly typed, the name is white, but if not, then it's light blue:

![screen shot 2017-09-27 at 3 04 38 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63830/30940251-4979307c-a395-11e7-9cc9-d1fe1ef08c5b.png)

This can look strange:

![screen shot 2017-09-27 at 3 09 01 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63830/30940400-d5234388-a395-11e7-8c54-40471033c6f0.png)

![screen shot 2017-09-27 at 3 13 12 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63830/30940597-6e35802c-a396-11e7-8884-a478702c69bf.png)

Note that the syntax highlighting for variables is consistent in this case:

![screen shot 2017-09-27 at 3 16 10 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63830/30940722-ebb64b26-a396-11e7-9c27-72ab11d03050.png)
![screen shot 2017-09-27 at 3 16 23 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63830/30940723-ebbe7242-a396-11e7-8385-2a9c3b6e36e1.png)

@ramya-rao-a: Should all syntax highlighting issues be created with atom instead of here?

---

data.title: Cannot read terminal content - nano
data.body:
Testing #34868 

When I load up Nano I can;t see the control chars at the bottom and also their are some strange artifacts at the top of the terminal.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1051190/30939935-181ff106-a394-11e7-80ed-bfa93a9e1621.png)

data.title: Content does not reflow on resize
data.body:
Testing #34868 

When the terminal has text flowing over many lines it does not reflow the text to full window size (or a reduced window size).

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1051190/30939523-8854881c-a392-11e7-8e1e-c3657ee61bdd.png)

The native terminal does do this and this does work on Windows for our integrated terminal.

Sean
